akn:subsection.akn:heading: Compensation for services rendered and reimbursement for expenses

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Compensation for services rendered and reimbursement for expenses After notice to the parties in interest and the United States Trustee and a hearing, the court may award to a professional person employed by the debtor (in the debtor’s sole discretion), the Oversight Board (in the Oversight Board’s sole discretion), a committee under section 1103 of title 11, or a trustee appointed by the court under section 926 of title 11—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Award of compensation less than amount requested

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Award of compensation less than amount requested The court may, on its own motion or on the motion of the United States Trustee or any other party in interest, award compensation that is less than the amount of compensation that is requested.

(d) Services ineligible for compensation The court shall not allow compensation for—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Offset for interim compensation under section 2177 of this title

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Offset for interim compensation under The court shall reduce the amount of compensation awarded under this section by the amount of any interim compensation awarded under section 2177 of this title, and, if the amount of such interim compensation exceeds the amount of compensation awarded under this section, may order the return of the excess to the debtor.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Compensation for preparation of fee application

akn:content.akn:p: (f) Compensation for preparation of fee application Any compensation awarded for the preparation of a fee application shall be based on the level and skill reasonably required to prepare the application.
